   How Stealth Bombers Work
   The B-2 stealth bomber is the result of one of the most ambitious projects ever undertaken by the United States
 military. Discover the amazing technology behind this flying wing and how it manages to appear smaller than a sparrow on radar. Read more about how stealth bombers work. 
 Also at HowStuffWorks
 

How Diamonds Work - Diamonds are made up of one of the most common elements on
earth -- carbon -- yet they're also considered to be the most valuable of
precious stones. Learn how diamonds form deep in the Earth, how they're cut and
how one company has changed how the world values diamonds.
 

How Crossbows Work - The crossbow, a weapon popular with Wookiees, vampire
slayers and some modern hunters, has been around for thousands of years. Find
out how ancient Chinese and Mediterranean
societies used crossbows and how they're used today.
 

How Electromagnets Work - Electromagnets are one of the fundamental components of
numerous electronic devices: motors, solenoids, hard disks, speakers, and so
on. Learn how electromagnets work and try several experiments to create your
own electromagnets.
   
This Week's Video 
How Fuel Cells Work - Fuel cells have the potential to power anything from
microprocessors to entire power plants. In this video from HowStuffWorks, learn
about the exciting potential of fuel cells and why governments, corporations
and universities are investing lots of money to develop effective fuel cells.
